insights.title: Peak Productivity Hour Identified
insights.description: Most commits occur at 3:00 AM (10 commits). This appears to be your most productive coding time.
insights.recommendation: Protect this time block from meetings and interruptions for focused coding work.

insights.title: Monday is Your Most Productive Day
insights.description: 10 commits on Mondays indicate this is your most productive day of the week.
insights.recommendation: Schedule important coding tasks and deep work for this day when possible.

insights.title: Late Night Coding Pattern Detected
insights.description: 17 commits (100%) occur between 10 PM and 5 AM.
insights.recommendation: Consider adjusting work schedule for better work-life balance. Late night coding can lead to burnout and lower code quality.

insights.title: Contributor Overload Detected
insights.description: mr-ahtashamulhaq is responsible for 82% of all commits. Workload is heavily concentrated.
insights.recommendation: Distribute work more evenly across the team to prevent burnout and reduce dependency on single individuals.

insights.title: No Testing Commands Detected
insights.description: No test execution commands found in recent history. Tests may not be running regularly.
insights.recommendation: Integrate testing into your workflow. Run tests before commits and consider setting up pre-commit hooks.
